snippet: President Obama is right to push a personalized approach to health care forward, though high costs remain a concern.
abstract: Editorial praises proposal contained in Pres Obama's budget that promotes practice of 'personalized medicine,' also known as 'precision medicine'; notes that while practice may not live up to hype of curing diseases that are currently incurable, increasing funding for personalized medicine could revolutionize care and would almost certainly result in best quality of care.
lead_paragraph: President Obama is right to push a personalized approach to health care forward, though high costs remain a concern.
